list_definition.definition: a large and magnificent house, especially one lived in by a king or queen

list_ex_of_english: Other non-epicentral interments and later on-floor deposits in palaces contain slightly heavier and larger spindle whorls that may have been used to spin a wider variety of vegetable fibers.
In this situation, at least one of the rhymes for palaces must be an off-rhyme.

Like many before and after him, he used the architectural structure and the interior decoration of his palaces to demonstrate and buttress the existing hierarchical order.
However, it is also possible that apprentices or attached specialists worked in and around the palaces of the king's family on valuable raw materials and in creating high-status goods.
Only 11 can properly be described as palaces.
We do not want palaces; we want reasonably good buildings, and the present ones could be improved.
The concerts take place in the palaces of the princely residence and other historic venues in the region.
